entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Greatwyrm lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The Greatwyrm Expanded Spells table shows the greatwyrm spells that are added to the warlock spell list for you, along with the spells associated in the table with your patron's family: chromatic, metallic, gem or planar.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Affinity
entries: Some of your patrons magic empowered you. Starting a 1st level, you can read, speak and write draconic and you gain resistance to the damage type associated to your patron.

subclassFeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: At 6th level, as a bonus action, you can exhale destructive energy in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone (your choice). Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d10} damage of the type affiliated with your patron. You can use this feature a number of time equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after you finish a long rest. Alternatively, you can expend one of your warlock spell slots to immediatly regain all expended uses of this feature.
This feature's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 11th level ({@damage 3d10}) and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of the Greatwyrm
entries: At 10th level, your Patron bestowed some of its power onto you. You gain one of the following features depending on the family of your patron:

entries.name: Frightful Presence
entries: As an action, you can force each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you and aware of you to succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Psychic Step
entries: As a bonus action, you magically teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries: You don't require food or air.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Transformation
entries: Starting at 14th level, you learned to manifest some of your patrons magic. As a bonus action, you manifest draconic features like scales and wings. When you do so, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.
you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
You breath weapon deals an additional 1d10 damage and its area increases to a 90-foot line or a 60-foot cone.
Immediatly after you assume your draconic form, you can use your breath weapon once.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest, unless you expend one of your warlock spell slots to use it again.
